item.title: This Raspberry Pi transparent display is made using a glass dome
item.description: VEEB Projects has put together a cool transparent Raspberry Pi display using a glass dome and a program that replicates the Pepper's Ghost effect.

item.title: Dual Raspberry Pi Picos power this portable mini PC
item.description: Abe's Projects has put together a custom mini PC using two Raspberry Pi Picos featuring a touchscreen, custom apps, and a built in keyboard.

item.title: Accessibility improvements for screen readers on raspberrypi.com
item.description: We’ve updated our pages, forms, and CAPTCHA infrastructure on raspberrypi.com to improve accessibility for screen reader users.

item.title: Retrouvez nous sur Tech Inn’Vitré les 14 et 15 février 2026
item.description: Les 14 et 15 février 2026, je vous donne rendez-vous à Vitré pour le salon Tech Inn’Vitré (Usages numériques), organisé par Vitré Communauté et Makeme. item.title: Raspberry Pi 5 price increases drastically as AI shortage bites, 16GB version now $205 — second price increase in three months, over 70% more expensive than original MSRP
item.description: Raspberry Pi is increasing its prices again.

item.title: Concours Mace Robotics : un Raspberry Pi 5 (et un Pico 2W) à gagner !

item.title: Alien fan builds a better Raspberry Pi cyberdeck — The MU/TH/UR of all homages to a classic movie series
item.description: Powered by the Raspberry Pi Zero 2W, Jeff Merrick's slab of 1970 / 1980s aesthetic screams the "charm" of the worn and broken Alien universe that belies the powerful single board computer within.

item.title: Raspberry Pi AI HAT+ 2 Review: The brains and the brawn
item.description: Raspberry Pis latest AI accessory brings a more powerful Hailo NPU, capable of LLMs and image inference, but the price tag is a key deciding factor.

item.title: Raspberry Pi AI HAT+ 2 : vision par ordinateur en vidéo avec Hailo-10H (Partie 2)
item.description: Dans cette seconde partie, le Raspberry Pi 5 passe à l’action avec la vidéo temps réel accélérée par Hailo-10H. Détection de personnes, cadrage dynamique, pose squelette et reconnaissance des mains : on enchaîne les modèles concrets. L’objectif est d’évaluer les performances réelles, les limites, et les bons compromis en situation réelle. item.description: Aujourd’hui, je vous propose de découvrir Pimmich, un cadre photo connecté open source basé sur Raspberry Pi, pensé pour afficher vos souvenirs sans cloud ni abonnement, en restant 100% local. item.title: Raspberry Pi and mini PC home lab prices hit parity as DRAM costs skyrocket — price hikes force hobbyists to weigh up performance versus power consumption
item.description: The price of a Raspberry Pi now has parity with Intel N100 mini PCs at just over $200, with flash memory price spikes continuing to push prices up across the board.

item.title: New York's Mayoral Inauguration bans Raspberry Pi and Flipper Zero — devices join explosives, guns, drones, and beach balls on prohibited items list
item.description: The invitation to Mayor-elect Mamdani's inauguration lists Raspberry Pi and Flipper Zero as prohibited items but does not provide a reason.

item.title: Utiliser Google Earth sur Raspberry Pi : la solution Web qui fonctionne
item.description: L’application Google Earth n’est plus réellement maintenue sous Linux, et elle n’existe plus du tout en version native pour les architectures ARM, comme celles des Raspberry Pi. La dernière version officielle pour Linux date de 2020, et son installation sur un Pi (ARM) est aujourd’hui vouée à l’échec. item.title: Raspberry Pi 5 : piloter des LEDs WS2812B de manière fiable avec le bus SPI
item.description: La question du pilotage des LEDs WS2812B sur Raspberry Pi 5 a récemment été soulevée par Victor lors d’un échange sur un réseau social. item.title: Creator makes Wi-Fi sound like dial-up Internet — uses Raspberry Pi and 2-watt speaker to convert digital data into analog signals
item.description: This Raspberry Pi project captures Wi-Fi data and then blasts it out as sound to make it feel like you're connecting via a dial-up modem.

item.title: Raspberry Pi 500+ Review: RGB clicky keys and NVMe storage, but with a $200 price tag
item.description: Raspberry Pi has released an updated version of the Raspberry Pi 500 and this time the omitted NVMe storage is present, as is an RGB mechanical keyboard.

item.title: Hardcore fan celebrates Alien: Earth by building a fully-working M314 Motion Tracker replica — DreamHAT+ Radar module and Raspberry Pi is effective up to 15 meters, complete with sounds and a display
item.description: Electronics hobbyist Rob Smith has built a ‘fully working M314 Motion Tracker’.

item.title: Raspberry Pi releases smaller five-inch Touch Display 2 — lower in price, same resolution as larger model
item.description: Raspberry Pi releases a smaller model of its updated touch display. This time with $20 off the price but the same display as the larger model.

item.title: The dream of a Raspberry Pi laptop becomes a reality — ArgonOne Up Review
item.description: Argon40’s new Raspberry Pi Compute Module 5-powered laptop has it all, but the price makes it a considered purchase.

item.title: Nephew of the ZX Spectrum inventor has created a handheld Raspberry Pi gaming console the size of a gift card — GamerCard features 4-inch square IPS screen and pre-loaded arcade games
item.description: GamerCard is a retro gaming handheld so portable than it's literally the size of a gift card, so you can now casually spend $170 at checkout.

item.title: This Raspberry Pi Zero camera instantly prints photos using thermal paper
item.description: Spacerower is using a Raspberry Pi Zero to power this custom 3D-printed camera that instantly prints out photos using thermal paper.

item.title: Raspberry Pi Pico fightstick randomly mashes buttons for fighting game combos
item.description: Goblinhan Yıkan has created a Raspberry Pi Pico-powered fight stick that has extra buttons for throwing random combos while playing fighting games.

item.title: Raspberry Pi Pico 2 FFT sound spectrum analyzer visualizes audio via OLED display
item.description: Dan McCreary shows off how to create your own FFT sound spectrum analyzer using our favorite microcontroller, the Raspberry Pi Pico 2.

item.title: Raspberry Pi's new PoE+ Injector supports all generations of PoE HATs
item.description: Raspberry Pi's new $25 PoE+ Injector bring power over Ethernet for the Raspberry Pi 3B+ and 4 via existing PoE HATs. The Raspberry Pi has to wait for the PoE+ HAT+ which has been in development since late 2023.

item.title: Maker builds Raspberry Pi ASCII camera, turning video frames into text-based imagery
item.description: André Esser is using a Raspberry Pi to power this ASCII camera project that he recently created for Pi Jam, celebrating Pi day.

item.title: 'Pi Tin' retro gaming handheld is minty fresh thanks to a Raspberry Pi Zero 2 W
item.description: Maker Jackw01 and Soaporsalad have put together a cool Raspberry Pi handheld featuring a Raspberry Pi 2 W that's small enough to fit in an Altoids tin.

item.title: Raspberry Pi 5 powered 'wall arcade' features a big, low-res RGB LED matrix display
item.description: John Park has created a cool Raspberry Pi-powered wall arcade that features multiple matrix panels as its main display.

item.title: Maker builds Raspberry Pi Pico smart clock with lots of cool features
item.description: NeverCode has created a Raspberry Pi Pico smart clock and shared lots of details on how you can recreate it for yourself at home.

item.title: Raspberry Pi and ChatGPT bring AI conversations to your retro rotary phone
item.description: Pollux Labs is using a Raspberry Pi to power this rotary phone project that integrates Chat GPT and remembers previous conversations.

item.title: Raspberry Pi Pico 2's RP2350 SoC goes on general sale
item.description: Raspberry Pi has announced the general availability of the RP2350 A and B, the SoC that powers the Raspberry Pi Pico 2 which features both an Arm and RISC-V CPU

item.title: Raspberry Pi Pico powers $75 PicoCalc portable programming handheld
item.description: ClockworkPi has released a cool Raspberry Pi Pico kit that lets you create a calculator suitable for handling your math homework or playing games.

item.title: Raspberry Pi and AI power open source smart city monitoring project
item.description: Glossyio has created a Raspberry Pi-powered traffic monitor that uses AI to monitor traffic and look for statistics around specific travelers like cyclists and pedestrians.

item.title: Voice controlled Raspberry Pi paper towel dispenser turns a prank into reality
item.description: Maker 3megabytesofhotram is using a Raspberry Pi to power a voice-activated paper towel dispenser that makes it easier than ever to dry your hands.

item.title: This smart Raspberry Pi LED world map has global appeal
item.description: Tribal2 is using a Raspberry Pi to drive this cool interactive LED world map that integrates with his smart home setup.

item.title: Raspberry Pi powers briefcase-sized PiEEG 'Bio Lab' project
item.description: Blink twice to control the robot arm

item.title: Raspberry Pi 5 powers cyberpunk themed brain scanner in a custom 3D printed case
item.description: The Civitas Universe has put together a cool Raspberry Pi cyberdeck that scans brains and features a cool cyberpunk theme in a custom 3D-printed case.

item.title: Run Windows 11 on Raspberry Pi 5 with Botspot Virtual Machine
item.description: Install Windows 11 for Arm on the Raspberry Pi 5 using the simplest installation method that we have ever encountered.

item.title: How to use an RFID reader with a Raspberry Pi Pico
item.description: (Image credit: Tom's Hardware) RFID cards and tags are everywhere! We use them in buildings for access control. Printers and photocopiers can use them to identify staff members. Livestock tagging and pet identification tags all use a form of RFID.

item.title: This illuminating Raspberry Pi Pico project wants to improve your photos and YouTube videos
item.description: Arnov Sharma built a Raspberry Pi Pico studio light from scratch that can be controlled using push buttons to adjust the LEDs with precision.

item.title: This Raspberry Pi Pico protractor has all of the angles covered!
item.description: Yaluke has created a Raspberry Pi Pico-powered protractor that can be used to calculate rotation data for simulating steering wheels when driving.

item.title: Maker builds Raspberry Pi-powered temperature gun using a Pico 2
item.description: Arnov Sharma has created a temperature gun from scratch using a Raspberry Pi Pico 2 as the main board.

item.title: This Raspberry Pi Snake console totally bites — in a good way
item.description: Arnov Sharma has put together a cool Raspberry Pi-powered handheld console for playing the classic game Snake on a Matrix.

item.title: Cozy cats live in a Raspberry Pi-powered luxury automated smart house
item.description: Visible_Turnover3952 has created a Raspberry Pi-powered cat house with luxurious smart home features and automated systems to keep them cozy.

item.title: Pineboards Modulo Series Review: All the extra features for your Raspberry Pi Compute Module 4 and 5
item.description: Three new carrier boards for your Compute Module 5 and the older Compute Module 4 which bring Raspberry Pi 5 accessories to the CM5, and PoE before Raspberry Pi releases its version.

item.title: Raspberry Pi 5 powers retro-futurism 1980s cyberdeck with custom milled keypad and wood finish
item.description: Nicholas LaBonte is using a Raspberry Pi to power this custom cyberdeck handheld complete with custom-milled keys and wood finishing.

item.title: Raspberry Pi powers custom cyberdeck inspired music player
item.description: Tonight-we-ride has put together a cool Raspberry Pi music player with a touchscreen and customizable interface with Winamp.

item.title: Argon40 teases the Raspberry Pi Compute Module 5 powered Argon One Up laptop (Updated)
item.description: Coming soon is a Kickstarter that sees the Compute Module 5 inside of a custom designed laptop.

item.title: This Raspberry Pi Creeper robot is bringing our Minecraft nightmares to real life
item.description: Efren Lopez has created a Raspberry Pi-powered Creeper robot from the Minecraft universe complete with an AI chip and a motorized body.

item.title: Raspberry Pi Pico brings a 'WOPR' of a feature to a server rack
item.description: Aforsberg has created a cool LED matrix display for their 1U server rack that's decked out like the WOPR computer from the 1983 movie War Games.

item.title: The Raspberry Pi Pico's RP2040 has been certified for 200 MHz clock speeds, up from 133 MHz
item.description: The Raspberry Pi 2040 now officially supports 200 MHz operation, thanks to the latest Pico-SDK release.

item.title: This Raspberry Pi map of Manhattan shows real-time subway train status
item.description: Bicapitate has created a custom Raspberry Pi-powered 3D-printed map of Manhattan that displays the location of subway trains in real time using LEDs and optical fiber.

item.title: Multiple Raspberry Pi create 'wigglegram' 3D photos using this AI enhanced camera
item.description: Low-Junket9298 has created a 3D camera from scratch using five Raspberry Pis with a little help from AI to create wigglegrams.

item.title: Pi Pico Pinout Display on the Command Line
item.description: Displaying the pinout of a Raspberry Pi Pico is possible using my “picopins” script. The script displays the pinout in a colour coded format showing the location of power, ground and GPIO pins. I find it useful if I’m coding Pico projects on my laptop or Pi 400 and need to check the location of [...]

item.title: Disable Auto-login in Raspberry Pi OS
item.description: This guide explains how to disable auto-login on Raspberry Pi OS. By default when you install the Raspberry Pi OS with the desktop it will auto-login when you power-up the Pi. This is really convenient for lots of projects as it gets you straight to the desktop. If you are using your Pi as a [...]
